title: Trump’s Student Arrests, and the Lawsuit Fighting Them, Tread New Ground
summary: The Trump administration’s efforts to deport foreign students who espoused pro-Palestinian views under a little-used foreign policy provision have no obvious legal parallel.

title: G.M. Profit Shrinks on Billion-Dollar Tariff Hit
summary: General Motors was the second auto company this week, after Stellantis, to show the toll that President Trump’s trade policies are taking on the industry.

title: In Search of Trade Deal, Philippines’ Leader Will Meet With Trump
summary: President Trump has placed a 20 percent tariff on goods imported from the country, effective Aug. 1.

title: M.L.K. Files Released, and Troops Are Withdrawing From California
summary: Plus, the missing child case that changed America.

title: The Missing Boy Whose Case Keeps Coming Back
summary: Etan Patz’s face stared out at America. His disappearance shaped childhoods for decades.

title: A Timeline of the Etan Patz Case
summary: It has been 46 years since 6-year-old Etan Patz disappeared in SoHo. After a lawsuit and two criminal trials, questions remain about how he died.

title: Trump Releases Thousands of Martin Luther King Jr. Files
summary: Historians said they saw little of note in the assassination records that President Trump disclosed despite opposition from most of Dr. King’s family.

title: Mormon Tabernacle Choir Records Its 5,000th Show
summary: “Music & the Spoken Word” has been on the air since 1929. Much has changed, yet much has remained exactly the same.

title: Israel Expands Attacks in Central Gaza City and Raids W.H.O. Offices
summary: Strikes in the central part of the territory targeted a city, Deir al-Balah, that had largely been spared and that had become an informal refuge for Palestinians fleeing other areas.

title: Fiona Hill on Trump, Putin and Why Great Powers Fall
summary: The former White House aide recently returned to her roots, advising Britain on defense and taking a role at Durham University in northeastern England. She still has her eye on global threats.

title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, Theo Huxtable on ‘The Cosby Show,’ Dead at 54 After Drowning
summary: Mr. Warner, who played the only son of Bill Cosby’s character on the beloved 1980s sitcom, drowned in Costa Rica.

title: China’s Problem With Competition: There’s Too Much of It
summary: The Chinese government is taking steps to rein in what it calls “involution,” or excessive competition that is hurting local companies and fueling the country’s deflationary spiral.

title: Many Lung Cancers Are Now in Nonsmokers. Scientists Want to Know Why.
summary: The face of lung cancer — once older men with a history of smoking — has changed.

title: Judge Sentences Ex-Officer in Breonna Taylor Raid to Nearly 3 Years in Prison
summary: The sentence was a sharp rebuke to the Trump administration, which had requested he serve only one day behind bars.

title: TV Show Helps Identify Mother and Child Found Dead in Rome Park, and a Suspect
summary: When two bodies were found in a popular Roman park, Italians wanted answers. A TV program specializing in missing people helped identify them, and a suspect.

title: Sharing a Bed With Your Kid? It’s Totally Normal in Asia.
summary: Bed sharing tends to be unpopular and contentious in the United States. But in many Asian countries, the question is often not whether to do it, but when to stop.

title: Trump Wants to Put America First. He Has No Idea How.
summary: At the bottom of the president’s foreign policy is a curious void.

title: The Perverse Economics of Assisted Suicide
summary: In an aging world, assisted suicide may look to governments like a cost-saving measure.

title: Jon Stewart Supports Friend Stephen Colbert Through CBS Cancellation
summary: Stewart admitted that he was “certainly not the most objective to comment on this matter” before sharing his feelings about the end of “The Late Show.”

title: As Cost-Burdened New Yorkers Give Up Pets, Shelters Turn Them Away
summary: Many New Yorkers have been surrendering their pets because they can no longer afford to keep them, outpacing animal shelters’ capacity, a shelter official said.

title: Can The Washington Post’s TikTok Guy Make It Without The Post?
summary: Dave Jorgenson is starting his own video company that explains the news, with a twist. Think Jon Stewart meets Ron Burgundy.

title: Austria Prepares to Give Up ‘Dream’ of Disarmament
summary: Historically neutral, the country is set to double military spending, even in the midst of a budget crisis, as its neighbors also spend big to counter Russia.

title: When Betelgeuse Explodes, It’s Going to Take Out Another Star
summary: The tempestuous star in Orion’s shoulder has a buddy, and neither of their futures look bright.
